message:
From your experience what is the best value for ExecutionTimeout ?
cause we have a page that will let the user upload files but in case the user Internet Line is slow, he will end up seeing "System.Web.HttpException (0x80004005): Request timed out." 
What do you think ?
name: Are there any dangers in increasing the executionTimeout and maxRequestLength of an ASP.NET site?
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: I have a user who is trying to upload a 150 megabyte file using an ASP.NET site. They are getting an HttpException: System.Web.HttpException: Maximum request length exceeded. I believe I can solv...
